meta.title: CLI Plan – Initiative Task Queue (BL-0001 + BL-0004)
notes: This queue is intended to replace ad-hoc backlog work with an executable task list.
Start by completing INIT-PLN-0001 to expand this file into a granular, ordered queue.
Strict Make-era parity is no longer a requirement; prioritize clear contract + forward-looking UX.
NOTE: This file was regenerated after an accidental cleanup deleted the untracked queue file; task IDs/orders were preserved.

phases.title: Planning
goals: Decompose BL-0001 and BL-0004 into an executable task queue with clear dependencies.
Identify contract/spec changes required before implementation work.

phases.title: Initiative — BL-0001 ADR Commands + Validation
goals: Introduce first-class ADR commands (starting with `ph adr add`).
Make ADR validation errors actionable and test-backed.

phases.title: Initiative — BL-0004 PH_ROOT Marker + Config Under `.project-handbook/`
goals: Keep planning docs in the repo root while keeping CLI-owned state under `.project-handbook/`.
Explicitly provide no legacy compatibility for root-level `project_handbook.config.json` and ensure errors point to `.project-handbook/config.json`.

tasks.kickoff_prompt:
Goal: Create an executable task queue for BL-0001 and BL-0004 (planning-only; no implementation).

Behaviors to implement/adjust:

Verification steps:

- PHASE-I01 and PHASE-I02 contain ordered, dependency-aware tasks that can be executed one-at-a-time.
- Each task kickoff_prompt lists exact files likely to change, concrete behavior changes, verification commands, and pass/fail acceptance criteria.

tasks.title: Contract: adopt `.project-handbook/config.json` marker (no legacy compatibility)
tasks.kickoff_prompt:
Goal: Update the v1 CLI contract to make `.project-handbook/config.json` the canonical (and only supported) handbook marker/config path (BL-0004).

Files likely to change:
- cli_plan/v1_cli/CLI_CONTRACT.md

Behaviors to implement/adjust:
- Contract-level; no code yet.
- Root resolution: `PH_ROOT` is the nearest ancestor directory that contains `.project-handbook/config.json`.
- `ph init` creates `.project-handbook/config.json`.
- Explicitly state: `project_handbook.config.json` at repo root is not supported (no legacy compatibility; no migration command).

Verification steps:
- Doc review: ensure Root resolution, Repository asset contract, Schema/version compatibility, `ph init`, and `ph doctor` sections are internally consistent.
- Quick grep: `rg -n "project_handbook.config.json|\.project-handbook/config.json" cli_plan/v1_cli/CLI_CONTRACT.md` should reflect the new canonical marker path.

Acceptance criteria:
- CLI contract explicitly states the canonical marker/config path is `.project-handbook/config.json`.
- CLI contract does not promise legacy compatibility, remediation, or migration tooling.
- Contract text continues to reflect: planning docs remain at repo root; `.project-handbook/` is CLI-owned state/config + system-scope data; CLI does not execute repo-local Python at runtime.

tasks.title: Contract: add `ph adr ...` command surface (at minimum `ph adr add`) and ADR validation requirements
tasks.kickoff_prompt:
Goal: Update the CLI contract to introduce first-class ADR commands and strengthen ADR validation requirements (BL-0001).

Files likely to change:
- cli_plan/v1_cli/CLI_CONTRACT.md

Behaviors to implement/adjust:
- Contract-level; no code yet.
- Add a new command family:
  - `ph adr add --id ADR-#### --title <t> [--status draft] [--date YYYY-MM-DD]`
- Document an internal-only escape hatch flag:
  - `--force` exists for non-destructive override, but MUST NOT be shown in CLI help output.
- Define the strict ADR naming convention for `PH_ROOT/adr/`:
  - filename MUST be `NNNN-<slug>.md` where `NNNN` is 4 digits and `<slug>` is lowercase kebab-case.
  - front matter `id` MUST be `ADR-NNNN` and MUST match the filename numeric prefix.
- Define ADR validation requirements:
  - required H1 headings: `# Context`, `# Decision`, `# Consequences`, `# Acceptance Criteria` (error)
  - recommended H1 heading: `# Rollout` (warning)
  - validation errors are actionable (expected/found, missing lists, etc.)

Verification steps:
- Doc review: ensure command surface, file layout, and validation requirements are consistent with other v1 docs.

Acceptance criteria:
- CLI contract includes ADR command surface and strict validation requirements.
- Contract explicitly states `--force` is internal-only and not shown in help.

tasks.title: Tests: add ADR validation coverage (duplicates, mismatch, supersession consistency, headings)
tasks.kickoff_prompt:
Goal: Encode ADR validation rules as tests so the contract stays stable (strict conventions).

Files likely to change:
- tests/test_validate_adr.py (new)

Behaviors to implement/adjust:
- Tests only (no production code changes).
- Create minimal ADR fixtures under `adr/` and run `ph validate --quick`.
- Test cases should include:
  - filename not matching `NNNN-<slug>.md` → error
  - `id: ADR-0001` duplicated across two files → error (message includes both paths)
  - filename `0002-...md` with `id: ADR-0003` → error (expected vs found)
  - `status: superseded` without `superseded_by` → error (actionable message)
  - `superseded_by: ADR-9999` where the referenced ADR file does not exist → error (actionable message)
  - missing required headings `# Context`, `# Decision`, `# Consequences`, `# Acceptance Criteria` → error
  - missing recommended headings `# Rollout` → warning

Verification steps:
- `uv run pytest -q tests/test_validate_adr.py`

Acceptance criteria:
- Tests cover strict ADR validation rules.
